title: Spotting of Agar Plates
author: Opentrons
description: This protocol allows the robot to perform agar plate culture by precisely placing 2 drops of liquid 2 cm away from each other in petri dishes. Petri dishes used in the protocol are of 6 cm and 10 cm in diameter. Custom adapters are needed for the petri dishes in order to fit them on the robot deck.
process:
Download your protocol.
Upload your protocol into the OT App.
Set up your deck according to the deck map.
Calibrate your pipettes, labware and tiprack using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our support articles.
Hit "Run".
Bacterial culture 1 in a 15 mL Falcon tubes (slot 5, well A1) is mixed 5 times with volume of 1000 uL using a P1000.
A 40 uL drop of bacterial culture 1 is placed at 1 cm from a petri dish 1 center.
Step 1 is repeated for bacterial culture 2 (slot 5, well B1).
A 40 uL drop of bacterial culture 2 is placed at 1 cm from a petri dish 1 center, opposite from the previous drop.
Repeat steps 1-4 for every petri dish.
